parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

connection.name: data-source
connection.description: ConnectionProvider implementation which creates DB connections from a referenced DataSource

parameter.name: poolingProfile
parameter.description: Provides a way to configure database connection pooling.

parameter.name: columnTypes
parameter.description: Specifies non-standard column types

parameter.name: dataSourceRef
parameter.description: Reference to a JDBC DataSource object. This object is typically created using Spring. When using XA transactions, an XADataSource object must be provided.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

connection.name: derby
connection.description: Creates connections to a Derby database

parameter.name: poolingProfile
parameter.description: Provides a way to configure database connection pooling.

parameter.name: columnTypes
parameter.description: Specifies non-standard column types

parameter.name: transactionIsolation
parameter.description: The transaction isolation level to set on the driver when connecting the database.

parameter.name: useXaTransactions
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not the created datasource has to support XA transactions. Default is false.

parameter.name: database
parameter.description: Name of the database

parameter.name: subsubProtocol
parameter.description: Specifies where Derby should look for the database. The available options are: 'directory', 'memory', 'classpath' and 'jar'.

parameter.name: create
parameter.description: Indicates if the database should be created if it does not exist.

parameter.name: connectionProperties
parameter.description: Specifies a list of custom key-value connectionProperties for the config.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

connection.name: generic
connection.description: ConnectionProvider that creates connections for any kind of database using a JDBC URL and the required JDBC Driver Class

parameter.name: poolingProfile
parameter.description: Provides a way to configure database connection pooling.

parameter.name: columnTypes
parameter.description: Specifies non-standard column types

parameter.name: transactionIsolation
parameter.description: The transaction isolation level to set on the driver when connecting the database.

parameter.name: useXaTransactions
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not the created datasource has to support XA transactions. Default is false.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: JDBC URL to use to connect to the database.

parameter.name: driverClassName
parameter.description: Fully-qualified name of the database driver class.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: Database username

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Database password

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

connection.name: mssql

parameter.name: transactionIsolation

parameter.name: useXaTransactions

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Configures the host of the database.

parameter.name: instanceName
parameter.description: Configures the name of the SQL server instance where the database is.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: Configures the port of the database.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: The user to use for authentication against the database.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password to use for authentication against the database.

parameter.name: databaseName
parameter.description: Name of the default database to work with.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

extension.name: Database
extension.description: The Anypoint Database Connector allows you to connect to relational databases through the JDBC API.

operation.name: bulkDelete
operation.description: Allows executing one delete statement various times using different parameter bindings. This happens using one single Database statement, which has performance advantages compared to executing one single delete operation various times.

parameter.name: bulkInputParameters
parameter.description: A List of Maps in which every list item represents a row to be inserted, and the map contains the parameter names as keys and the value the parameter is bound to.

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: parameterTypes
parameter.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: bulkInsert
operation.description: Allows executing one insert statement various times using different parameter bindings. This happens using one single Database statement, which has performance advantages compared to executing one single update operation various times.

parameter.name: bulkInputParameters
parameter.description: A List of Maps in which every list item represents a row to be inserted, and the map contains the parameter names as keys and the value the parameter is bound to.

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: parameterTypes
parameter.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: bulkUpdate
operation.description: Allows executing one update statement various times using different parameter bindings. This happens using one single Database statement, which has performance advantages compared to executing one single update operation various times.

parameter.name: bulkInputParameters
parameter.description: A List of Maps in which every list item represents a row to be inserted, and the map contains the parameter names as keys and the value the parameter is bound to.

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: parameterTypes
parameter.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: parameterTypes
parameter.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values

parameter.name: inputParameters
parameter.description:
A Map which keys are the name of an input parameter to be set on the JDBC prepared statement. Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: where id = :myParamName)).

The map's values will contain the actual assignation for each parameter.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: executeDdl
operation.description: Enables execution of DDL queries against a database.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: executeScript
operation.description: Executes a SQL script in one single Database statement. The script is executed as provided by the user, without any parameter binding.

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: file
parameter.description: The location of a file to load. The file can point to a resource on the classpath or on a disk.

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: parameterTypes
parameter.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values

parameter.name: inputParameters
parameter.description:
A Map which keys are the name of an input parameter to be set on the JDBC prepared statement. Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: where id = :myParamName)).

The map's values will contain the actual assignation for each parameter.

parameter.name: autoGenerateKeys
parameter.description: Indicates when to make auto-generated keys available for retrieval.

parameter.name: autoGeneratedKeysColumnIndexes
parameter.description: List of column indexes that indicates which auto-generated keys to make available for retrieval.

parameter.name: autoGeneratedKeysColumnNames
parameter.description: List of column names that indicates which auto-generated keys should be made available for retrieval.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: select
operation.description: Selects data from a database. Streaming is automatically applied to avoid preemptive consumption of such results, which may lead to performance and memory issues.

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: parameterTypes
parameter.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values

parameter.name: inputParameters
parameter.description:
A Map which keys are the name of an input parameter to be set on the JDBC prepared statement. Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: where id = :myParamName)).

The map's values will contain the actual assignation for each parameter.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: storedProcedure
operation.description:
Invokes a Stored Procedure on the database.

When the stored procedure returns one or more ResultSet instances, streaming is automatically applied to avoid preemptive consumption of such results, which may lead to performance and memory issues.

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: parameterTypes
parameter.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values

parameter.name: inputParameters
parameter.description:
A Map which keys are the name of an input parameter to be set on the JDBC prepared statement. Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: where id = :myParamName)).

The map's values will contain the actual assignation for each parameter.

parameter.name: inOutParameters
parameter.description:
A Map which keys are the name of a parameter to be set on the JDBC prepared statement which is both input and output.

Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: where id = :myParamName)).

The map's values will contain the actual assignation for each parameter.

parameter.name: outputParameters
parameter.description: A list of output parameters to be set on the JDBC prepared statement. Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: call multiply(:value, :result))

parameter.name: autoGenerateKeys
parameter.description: Indicates when to make auto-generated keys available for retrieval.

parameter.name: autoGeneratedKeysColumnIndexes
parameter.description: List of column indexes that indicates which auto-generated keys to make available for retrieval.

parameter.name: autoGeneratedKeysColumnNames
parameter.description: List of column names that indicates which auto-generated keys should be made available for retrieval.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: parameterTypes
parameter.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values

parameter.name: inputParameters
parameter.description:
A Map which keys are the name of an input parameter to be set on the JDBC prepared statement. Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: where id = :myParamName)).

The map's values will contain the actual assignation for each parameter.

parameter.name: autoGenerateKeys
parameter.description: Indicates when to make auto-generated keys available for retrieval.

parameter.name: autoGeneratedKeysColumnIndexes
parameter.description: List of column indexes that indicates which auto-generated keys to make available for retrieval.

parameter.name: autoGeneratedKeysColumnNames
parameter.description: List of column names that indicates which auto-generated keys should be made available for retrieval.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

source.name: listener
source.description:
Selects from a table at a regular interval and generates one message per each obtained row.

Optionally, watermark and id columns can be provided. If a watermark column is provided, the values taken from that column will be used to filter the contents of the next poll, so that only rows with a greater watermark value are returned. If an id column is provided, this component will automatically make sure that the same row is not picked twice by concurrent polls

parameter.name: table
parameter.description: The name of the table to select from

parameter.name: watermarkColumn
parameter.description: The name of the column to use for watermark. Values taken from this column will be used to filter the contents of the next poll, so that only rows with a greater watermark value are processed.

parameter.name: idColumn
parameter.description: The name of the column to consider as row ID. If provided, this component will make sure that the same row is not processed twice by concurrent polls.

parameter.name: transactionalAction
parameter.description: The type of beginning action that sources can take regarding transactions.

parameter.name: transactionType
parameter.description: The type of transaction to create. Availability will depend on the runtime version.

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: schedulingStrategy
parameter.description: Configures the scheduler that triggers the polling

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

type.name: org.mule.extension.db.api.StatementResult
type.description: Information about the execution of a DML statement

type.name: org.mule.extension.db.api.config.DbPoolingProfile
type.description:
Pooling configuration for JDBC Data Sources capable of pooling connections
@since 1.0

parameter.name: maxPoolSize
parameter.description: Maximum number of connections a pool maintains at any given time

parameter.name: minPoolSize
parameter.description: Minimum number of connections a pool maintains at any given time

parameter.name: acquireIncrement
parameter.description: Determines how many connections at a time to try to acquire when the pool is exhausted

parameter.name: preparedStatementCacheSize
parameter.description: Determines how many statements are cached per pooled connection. Setting this to zero will disable statement caching

parameter.name: maxWait
parameter.description: The amount of time a client trying to obtain a connection waits for it to be acquired when the pool is exhausted. Zero (default) means wait indefinitely

parameter.name: maxWaitUnit
parameter.description: A #maxWait.

parameter.name: maxIdleTime
parameter.description: Determines how many seconds a Connection can remain pooled but unused before being discarded. Zero means idle connections never expire.

type.name: org.mule.extension.db.api.exception.connection.ConnectionCreationException
type.description: Thrown to indicate an error creating a connection

type.name: org.mule.extension.db.api.logger.LoggerApiPackage
type.description:
This is a class used just to export the package.

The Export annotation due that MuleMySqlLogger depends on MySql classes, so to prevent the connector fail when loading it when is used with other vendors like: Derby, Oracle, etc. this class is exported instead to export the entire package. @since 1.0

type.name: org.mule.extension.db.api.param.BulkQueryDefinition
type.description:
The definition of a bulk operations defined around one single SQL command
@since 1.0

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: parameterTypes
parameter.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Type identifier used by the JDBC driver.

parameter.name: typeName
parameter.description: Name of the data type used by the JDBC driver.

parameter.name: className
parameter.description: Indicates which Java class must be used to map the DB type.

type.name: org.mule.extension.db.api.param.OutputParameter
type.description:
An output parameter to be used in the context of a stored procedure call
@since 1.0

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The name of the input parameter.

type.name: org.mule.extension.db.api.param.ParameterType
type.description:
Allows specifying the type of a given parameter
@since 1.0

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The name of the input parameter.

type.name: org.mule.extension.db.api.param.QueryDefinition
type.description:
The definition for a DML query
@since 1.0

parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: parameterTypes
parameter.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values

parameter.name: inputParameters
parameter.description:
A Map which keys are the name of an input parameter to be set on the JDBC prepared statement. Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: :myParamName)).

The map's values will contain the actual assignation for each parameter.

type.name: org.mule.extension.db.api.param.StoredProcedureCall
type.description:
The definition of the invocation to a stored procedure
@since 1.0

parameter.name: queryTimeout
parameter.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.

parameter.name: queryTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: A #queryTimeout

parameter.name: fetchSize
parameter.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.

parameter.name: sql
parameter.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed

parameter.name: parameterTypes
parameter.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values

parameter.name: inputParameters
parameter.description:
A Map which keys are the name of an input parameter to be set on the JDBC prepared statement. Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: :myParamName)).

The map's values will contain the actual assignation for each parameter.

parameter.name: inOutParameters
parameter.description:
A Map which keys are the name of a parameter to be set on the JDBC prepared statement which is both input and output.

Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: :myParamName)).

The map's values will contain the actual assignation for each parameter.

parameter.name: outputParameters
parameter.description: A list of output parameters to be set on the JDBC prepared statement. Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: :result))
